intro_title: Welcome to the Elderly Immigrant Transport Guide
intro_text: This guide aims to help elderly immigrants confidently navigate Melbourne's public transportation system, including crosswalks, Myki cards, route planning, and safe boarding.
crosswalk_usage_text: How to Use Pedestrian Crossing Buttons:
crosswalk_instructions_1: Green Walking Figure: Safe to cross.
crosswalk_instructions_2: Flashing Red Figure: Do not start crossing, but complete your crossing if you have already started.
crosswalk_instructions_3: Steady Red Figure: Do not cross.
walk_signals_text_1: Locate the button box on the traffic light pole.
walk_signals_text_2: Press the button to activate the pedestrian crossing signal.
walk_signals_text_3: Wait for the green walking figure or the sound signal (beeping sound) indicating it‚Äôs safe to cross.
ticket_purchase: How to buy and top up Myki cards.
ticket_purchase_steps_1: Buy a Myki card from train stations, convenience stores, or online.
ticket_purchase_steps_2: Top up your card at Myki machines, 7-Eleven stores, or online.
ticket_purchase_steps_3: Keep your Myki card topped up for uninterrupted travel.
card_types_list_1: Myki Money: Pay as you go.
card_types_list_2: Myki Pass: Unlimited travel for a set period.
card_types_list_3: Concession Myki: Discounted fares for eligible passengers.
using_google_maps: Using Google Maps for public transport directions.
route_planning_steps_1: Open the Google Maps app and enter your destination.
route_planning_steps_2: Choose the public transport option for detailed directions.
finding_correct_stop: Finding the Correct Bus, Tram, or Train Stop
stop_info_1: Each stop has a unique ID and real-time information display.
stop_info_2: Use the PTV app or website for more accurate local information.
set_alerts: Set alerts for transfers, delays, or platform changes.
platform_guidance: Finding the Right Platform or Stop
platform_guidance_text: Learn to read station maps and platform numbers.
boarding_tips_1: Wait for the vehicle to come to a complete stop before boarding.
boarding_tips_2: Use the handrails to prevent falls.
stop_button_usage: Using the Stop Button on Buses and Trams
stop_button_instruction: Press the red or yellow stop button to notify the driver you want to get off at the next stop.
priority_seating_text: Use priority seats near the front, which are reserved for seniors and those with mobility challenges.
seeking_help_text: Use the emergency intercom or notify the driver if you need assistance.
safety_security_text: Be aware of emergency exits and evacuation procedures.

home.heroSubtitle: Because everyone deserves to feel at home, no matter where they're from.
home.section1Desc: Take part in local events designed to bring older adults together ‚Äî from hobby groups and wellness activities to information sessions and friendly meetups.
home.section2Desc: Select a cultural identity and uncover the Australian suburbs where the community lives, connects, and celebrates.
home.section3Desc: Step-by-step guides to help you use public transport with confidence.
home.chatTitle: Need a Hand? Chat with Uni
home.chatDesc: Meet Uni, your friendly guide. If you're not sure where to go, just ask!

services.heroDesc: Explore Australian Government programs designed to support wellbeing, social connection, health, and independent living for seniors.

items.name: My Aged Care
items.description: The central portal for accessing government-funded aged care services including assessments, support at home, and service finders.

items.name: Commonwealth Home Support Programme (CHSP)
items.description: Entry-level services to help older people stay at home and be active in their community. Includes transport, social support, and meal delivery.

items.name: Home Care Packages
items.description: Coordinated support tailored to people with complex care needs to help them remain living safely at home.

items.name: Aged Care Volunteer Visitors Scheme (ACVVS)
items.description: Supports social connections by pairing older people with volunteer visitors for regular companionship.

items.name: National Aged Care Advocacy Program (NACAP)
items.description: Free advocacy to help older Australians understand and exercise their rights when using aged care services.

items.name: Disability Support for Older Australians (DSOA)
items.description: Continued support for people over 65 who were previously receiving specialist disability services but are not eligible for the NDIS.

items.name: Positive Ageing Initiatives
items.description: Programs that promote healthy and active ageing, lifelong learning, and social engagement for older adults.

items.name: Support at Home Program (from July 2025)
items.description: A new program combining CHSP and Home Care Packages into one flexible in-home support service for seniors.

items.name: Services in Rural and Remote Areas
items.description: Specialised aged care support and services tailored to the needs of rural and remote communities in Australia.

items.name: Aged Care Act 2024
items.description: A major reform aiming to create a simpler, fairer, and more compassionate aged care system in Australia.
